availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: J. Theobold Besancon (Louisville, Kentucky, tavern keeper)

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, tavern keeper. Native of Switzerland. Son of Conrad Besancon and Mary Besancon. Married to Maggie Besancon. Immigrated to the United States on November 14, 1848. Attended school in Erie County, New York, in 1850. Tavern keeper in Louisville, Kentucky, in 1860. Bar keeper at the William Tell Hotel in Louisville in 1861. Tavern keeper with Martin Miller in Miller & Company in Louisville in 1865.
